description: Unique identifier or code for the KPI used by reports and scheduling. Can be numeric or mnemonic.
Brief title used when displaying the KPI in lists, dashboards, or widgets.
Full business description explaining what the KPI measures and any important caveats.
Stored query or expression used to compute the KPI value from operational data.
Measurement unit for the KPI value (for example, currency, count, hours).
Stored KPI result from the most recent successful run; likely numeric value persisted for display; confirm with SME.
Indicator that this is a system-delivered default KPI (Y/N), not a custom one; confirm with SME.
Numeric display pattern applied to the KPI value when rendered in the UI.
Human-readable schedule for when the KPI should be recalculated; likely complements the cron field; confirm with SME.
Text of the last calculation error encountered for this KPI, if any.
User who created the KPI definition.
Timestamp when the KPI definition was created.
User who last modified the KPI definition.
Timestamp of the most recent modification to the KPI definition.
Whether the KPI is enabled for calculation and display (Y/N).
Date and time the KPI value was last successfully calculated.
User account that last executed the KPI calculation.
Cron expression defining the automated schedule for KPI calculation.
